es objetivo específico del proyecto reducir los factores de riesgo que ocasionan la presencia de enfermedades infectocontagiosas y respiratorias en la comunidad, mejorando las condiciones de habitabilidad, promoviendo la gestión adecuada de residuos sólidos y el tratamiento sanitario del agua potable y residual, incorporando el cuidado ambiental, la educación sanitaria y planificación participativa de la gestión.para ello se plantea la realización de las siguientes actividades:a)generación de políticas públicas saludables para el manejo de residuos en la comunidad de pampa cangallo,b)elaboración de un plan de acción para la recolección y manejo de residuos,c) implementación de un centro de reciclaje municipal,d)cloración de reservorios de agua,e)colocación de papeleras,f) realización de talleres de capacitación sobre separación de residuos,g) realización de concurso ?instituciones educativas limpias y saludables?,h) talleres de capacitación para la elaboración de materiales decorativos y utilitarios con materiales de reciclaje. dirigido a docentes de instituciones edcuativas,i) campañas comunicacionales para el cuidado del medio ambiente.(spot radio, radioteatros...),j) feria lúdica de sensibilización para el manejo adecuado de la basura en el distrito,k) realización de pasantias a comunidades saludables, dirigidas a los docentes de las instituciones educativas,l) realización de dos talleres de capacitación sobre la recolección segregada de residuos sólidos y su aprovechamiento,m) recuperación de áreas degradadas para su uso como espacio de recreo y biohuertos,n) realización de concurso ?calles limpias y libres de residuos sólidos?,o) realización de talleres de uso y mantenimiento de servicios higiénicos,p) taller de capacitación para la elaboración de juguetes con materiales reciclados,k) asistencia técnica a las familias para la elaboración de compost, r)la implementación de espacios de recreación, biohuertos y actividades del proyecto,s) construcción de lavaderos en domicilios y capacitación para su uso adecuado,t) implementación de 80 cocinas mejoradas y u) asistencia técnica, acompañamiento y administración del proyecto.la intervención contempla una metodología participativa, a través de talleres, reuniones, asambleas comunales, capacitaciones prácticas, asistencia técnica y campañas de sensibilización que impliquen a toda la población e instituciones. tadepa es una institución privada sin fines de lucro creada en 1978, que desde sus inicios ha trabajado en ayacucho, dedicada primordialmente a proyectos de desarrollo sostenibles a largo plazo. -- geographical target area : el presente proyecto se ubica en ayacucho, uno de los departamentos más pobres de perú, concretamente en la provincia de cangallo, en la comunidad campesina de pampacangallo del distrito de los morochucos. --

el proyecto se localiza en un área de bosque tropical de la cuenca del río pastaza, en la región de loreto, en la amazonia septentrional peruana fronteriza con ecuador. tiene como población destinataria a los quechua del pastaza, una etnia que practica una economía de substistència y depende del bosque tropical y los ríos para la alimentación, la medicina, los recursos y la reproducción social y cultural como pueblo.

se pretende elaborar una publicación para la difusión de las tecnologías energéticas apropiadas para el desarrollo humano. para ello se recogerán datos en terreno sobre proyectos ya implementados por distintas organizaciones con distintos tipos de tecnologías y, juntamente con la experiencia acumulada anteriormente con las ongds que participan en este proyecto, se redactará un manual que permita desarrollar actividades de incidencia política en el sur, así como de sensbilización a la comunidad universitaria en el norte.se ha desarrollado el proyecto en colaboración con la organización soluciones prácticas.

el proyecto pretende desarrollar diversas acciones de sensibilización y protección de los pueblos en aislamiento y contacto inicial en dos líneas de trabajo complementarias y necesarias entre si. por un lado se pretende desarrollar una línea de trabajo dirigida a sensibilizar y generar conciencia sobre la necesidad de proteger a estos pueblos. para ello se realizará un documental sobre las situaciones y problemas que sufren estos pueblos en la actualidad y posteriormente se realizará una campaña de difusión del documental en todos los países de la región, acompañada de charlas y debates con expertos y organizaciones indígenas para incidir más en el mensaje. por otro lado se continuará con las acciones de protección de los pueblos en aislamiento y de sus territorios a través de la implementación de las directrices de naciones unidas para la protección de los pueblos en aislamiento y contacto inicial.

el proyecto se gestiona a través de una oficina de gestión patrimonial y cultural con el objetivo de generar y afianzar las capacidades técnicas capaces de viabilizary desarrollar una gestión sostenible de los recursos culturales y naturales del valle del colca, encoordinación con los gobiernos locales, instituciones privadas y públicas, ong’s,cooperaciones internacionales, etc.. además de brindar asesoramiento y apoyotécnico permanente a la población en temas ligados al patrimonio.esta oficina (ogpc), estará integrada dentro de la estructura de autocolca yasesorada por la municipalidad provincial de caylloma. se compone básicamentepor cuatro áreas:Área técnica, Área territorio y medio ambiente, Área de documentación y el Área de gestión cultural

nmbca** - project partners will implement a comprehensive plan for reserve expansion and implement on-the-ground management activities to protect wetland habitats particularly in the san pedro mangroves (3013 ha); and establish a monitoring program to include the whsrn site assessment tool, bird monitoring, and hydrologic monitoring.

conservation of archeological artifacts from the royal tombs of sipan
conservation of archeological artifacts from the royal tombs of sipan

to support the conservation of more than 900 archeological artifacts from the royal tombs of sipan in lambayeque. one of the most important pre-columbian sites in peru, the royal tombs of sipan have had a major impact on the field of pre-columbian archaeology and the study of mochica culture. the project includes the documentation and conservation of artifacts and improvements to the display environment within the sipan site museum.

capacity building for natural reserves? rangers and their professional guild
capacity building for natural reserves? rangers and their professional guild

specialized training for natural reserves? rangers and exchange of experiences among them as well as organizational consolidation of their professional association throughout a national congress of rangers. the training will include: guidelines to face climate change effects on their working areas; national policy for environmental education; sharing experiences on eradication of illicit crops; sharing experiences on eco tourism; biology as a tool for conservancy; management of natural reserves; patrolling and control of poaching and illegal logging.
forestry education/training

alleviating the deforestation pressure in the buffer zones of both cordillera escalera regional natural reserve and cordillera azul national park through the promotion of sustainable management of two native palms for the production of vegetal ivory and brooms. the communities are already involved in the extraction of non wooden forestry products with good commercial demand which will give them a source of incomes alternative to logging or deforesting for introducing livestock. this phase will allow them to start giving added value to their production/ san martin (north eastern amazonia)

alleviating the deforestation pressure in the buffer zones of both cordillera escalera regional natural reserve and cordillera azul national park through the promotion of sustainable management of two native palms for the production of vegetal ivory and brooms. the communities are already involved in the extraction of non wooden forestry products with good commercial demand which will give them a source of incomes alternative to logging or deforesting for introducing livestock. this phase will allow them to start giving added value to their production/ san martin (north eastern amazonia)
bio-diversity

participative conservation and sustainable use of the orchid phragmipedia kovachii endemic species of amazonas & san martin regions (north western amazonia of peru).continuation of a former project seeking to save the species from extinction and help to preserve the whole forest in the area (a natural reserve threatened by extractive activities of surrounding population) through the involvement of local people by offering to them the possibility of getting monetary incomes from eco tourism and in vitro cultivation of the endangered orchid. this last support will allow them to implement the recommendations of a marketing study meant to assure the future sustainability of the new activities proposed to local people and to provide some additional equipment to the centre of interpretation and rangers' post for it to serve as lodging facility for future tourists and researchers.

consolidating an agro forestry initiative already implemented by local people in madre de dios

consolidating an agro forestry initiative already implemented by local people enriching the plantations and introducing beekeeping as an additional source of incomes. the area is threatened by the advance of illegal gold mining and the goal of the project is to provide local people the required strength to confront it. they are including activities to assure commercial connections for assuring sustainability./ madre de dios (southern amazonia of peru).

for one of the first time in its history, sdc can exert important leverage effects – with little funding – upon nation-wide and international scaling up operations in peru. the global program water initiatives decided to support this new generation of projects to demonstrate how sdc can generate added value and influence the global debate. the peruvian authorities want to capitalize on sdc 15-year experience in rural water and sanitation in rural areas for boosting full national coverage of such services.this initiative is a new generation of projets required to respond: to the water & sanitation mdg’s water related targets and to the human right to access to water & sanitation.

le programme d'adaptation au changement climatique a comme finalité de contribuer à consolider les conditions de vie des communautés dans les régions andines de cusco et apurimac en réduisant la vulnérabilité - surtout des couches sociales défavorisées - face aux conséquences du changement climatique. les résultats attendus du pacc à l'horizon 2011-2012 sont au nombre de quatre: 1. connaître la vulnérabilité - les régions de cusco et apurimac ont développé des diagnostics et dressé la liste des conditions d'adaptation au changement climatique avec la participation des populations affectées, de leurs autorités et d'institutions spécialisées. 2. mesurer et informer - un système régional d'information publique sur le changement climatique et ses effets est établi et validé par les autorités. 3. agir dans des districts choisis - des mesures d'adaptation priorisées sont mises en œuvre dans des districts sélectionnés dans chacune des deux régions. 4. apprendre et influencer les politiques publiques - le thème de l'adaptation au changement climatique est bien présent dans les politiques publiques, aux trois niveaux : pays, régions et municipalités rurales, en s'inspirent des expériences générées par le pacc.

confronted with changing environments and growing poverty and inequalities, many small-scale farmers from the andes have been forced to adopt innovative livelihood strategies. they have done this by combining practical knowledge, local talent and external assets to manage their natural resources in creative and novel ways - ways that result in increased food and income security, and allow them to escape from poverty. this project will explore ways of stimulating and scaling up the innovations of small-scale farmers. in collaboration with stakeholders, researchers will examine instances of scaled-up innovation in farm production, natural resource management and off-farm income generation and develop policies and programs in consequence. the project will focus initially on peru and be extended to other andean countries, and potentially africa.

the project’s objective is to further develop the co-management approach for the protection measures in communal reserves in the amazon region of peru and to implement it in selected communal reserves for indigenous communities. therefor there will be interventions in the development of co-management concepts, the protection of biodiversity and forests, sustainable use and knowledge management.

the international forest carbon initiative (ifci) is an initiative jointly managed by ausaid and the department of climate change and energy efficiency which purpose is to support global efforts to reduce carbon emissions from deforestation. funding of volunteers under ifci is to encompass volunteer placements in developing countries through government and non-government organisations in areas relevant to ifci objectives. the total value of this initiative is $1.3 million during the 2011-12 financial year.

the international forest carbon initiative (ifci) is an initiative jointly managed by ausaid and the department of climate change and energy efficiency which purpose is to support global efforts to reduce carbon emissions from deforestation. funding of volunteers under ifci is to encompass volunteer placements in developing countries through government and non-government organisations in areas relevant to ifci objectives. the total value of this initiative is $1.3 million during the 2011-12 financial year.

the ausaid-non-government organisations (ngos) cooperation program (ancp) is a long-running program that subsidises the overseas development activities of accredited australian ngos. through the ancp, ausaid supports accredited australian ngos to implement their own international development programs. this initiative specifically provides funding to 'partnership' ngos. under the partnership agreements, ausaid and the partnership ngos are working more strategically on addressing issues such as child protection, gender, food security and climate change to accelerate the joint efforts of both government and non-government organisations to help reach the millennium development goals. the ancp also aims to enhance ngo effectiveness and accountability through a well-developed accreditation and reporting system, and to promote innovation in the sector through the ancp innovations fund. the total value of the program for all countries is $440 million over 6 years, starting 2009-10.

preventive conservation of ancient paracas textiles and other pre-hispanic andean objects in ica
preventive conservation of ancient paracas textiles and other pre-hispanic andean objects in ica

to support the preventive conservation of ancient paracas textiles, archaeological objects, ceramics, and other pre-hispanic andean objects from 800 to 100 bc. paracas textiles are among the finest in the world and renowned for their technique and iconography. this project includes the cataloging, photo documentation, and registration of objects and the conservation of a small number of textiles deemed at greatest risk of deterioration.

conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. programs in this element should be integrated with the agriculture area under economic growth and conflict mitigation and reconciliation area under the peace and security objective, when applicable and appropriate. [through government of peru]

territory and natural resources management in the peru border (second part).
territory and natural resources management in the peru border (second part).

gestión del territorio y de los recursos naturales en la frontera del perú ( 2ª parte) :: el proyecto persigue aportar a la gobernabilidad democrática y a la construcción de alternativas endógenas y sostenibles de desarrollo fortaleciendo las capacidades de los actores locales y regionales de la frontera entre el perú y el ecuador en el área de influencia de las actividades y concesiones mineras. el proyecto centra sus actividades en la construcción participativa de instrumentos para la prevención y transformación de conflictos socioambientales, en la impartición de ciclos formativos para autoridades y líderes locales, elaboración de planes de acción, construcción de infraestructuras básicas ( local de reuniones) , diseño e impulso de campañas de sensibilización e información, realización de diagnósticos técnicos y constitución de organismos locales de participación.

gestión del territorio y de los recursos naturales en la frontera del perú ( 2ª parte) :: el proyecto persigue aportar a la gobernabilidad democrática y a la construcción de alternativas endógenas y sostenibles de desarrollo fortaleciendo las capacidades de los actores locales y regionales de la frontera entre el perú y el ecuador en el área de influencia de las actividades y concesiones mineras. el proyecto centra sus actividades en la construcción participativa de instrumentos para la prevención y transformación de conflictos socioambientales, en la impartición de ciclos formativos para autoridades y líderes locales, elaboración de planes de acción, construcción de infraestructuras básicas ( local de reuniones) , diseño e impulso de campañas de sensibilización e información, realización de diagnósticos técnicos y constitución de organismos locales de participación.

?lieu d?intervention : national, cibl? sur les r?gions de madre de dios et puno -les groupes de travail de madre de dios et puno;-secteurs du pouvoir qui prennent les d?cisions politiques (parlement, gouvernements r?gionaux et locaux) ;-osc (ongs, universit?s, consommateurs, m?dias et secteur priv?) ;-population rurale de madr les politiques publiques associ?es aux m?ga-investissements de l?amazonie sud du p?rou tiennent compte des aspects sociaux et environnementaux, outre les aspects ?conomiques. de m?me, elles favorisent la promotion du bien-?tre de la population affect?e la plus d?favoris?e, en mettant l?accent sur la pr?vention, la mitigation et la compensation des impacts socio environnementaux qui pourraient se pr?senter. les groupes de travail de la soci?t? civile de madre de dios et puno ont renforc?s leurs capacit?s d?incidence politique concernant la promotion ou l?impl?mentation des m?ga-investissements qui affectent le d?veloppement social et environnemental des r?gions mentionn?es. r?sultat 1 : la soci?t? civile de madre de dios et puno dispose d?information syst?matis?e et pertinente concernant les m?ga-investissements.r?sultat 2 : les groupes de travail de madre de dios et puno am?liorent leurs capacit?s d??laborer des propositions techniques li?es aux m?ga-investissements, pour influencer les politiques publiques. r?sultat 3:les groupes de travail de madre de dios et puno am?liorent l?efficacit? et la capacit? de r?ponse avec lesquelles ils interviennent sur les politiques publiques li?es aux m?ga-investissements. r?sultat 4:les groupes de travail de madre de dios et puno promeuvent des espaces d?interlocution soci?t? civile ? etat au niveau r?gional et national.

the promotion of a sustainable use of the natural resources in de regions of apur?mac, ayacucho, huancavelica, jun?n and pasco is the principal target of this intervention en las zonas de intervenci?n, el programa permitir˜ el uso adecuado y sostenible de los recursos naturales (renovables y no renovables), lo que contribuir˜ a la reducci?n de la pobreza y a la preservaci?n del patrimonio natural (conservaci?n de la biodiversidad, recursos h?dricos sostenibles y alto a la deforestaci?n). adem˜s, la mejora de la producci?n agr?cola orientada al mercado local, junto con la participaci?n positiva de las mujeres, promover˜n la seguridad alimentaria y contribuir˜n a reducir la malnutrici?n. los beneficiarios est˜n constituidos por pobladores pobres y pobres extremos de las regiones de apur?mac, ayacucho, huancavelica, jun?n y pasco. son 531.783 personas en total nivel de pobreza de los hombres y mujeres de las regiones considerados en el ˜mbito del programa reducido aprovechando en forma ordenada los recursos naturales y tomando en cuenta las necesidades de las generaciones futuras. al 2015, los recursos naturales en el ˜mbito de influencia del programa son identificados, valorizados, conservados y utilizados de manera sostenible de acuerdo a una planificaci?n a largo plazo y con una mayor productividad, competitividad y acceso a mercados para los hombres y mujeres que inicialmente viv?an en pobreza y extrema pobreza.

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qscep6tfixsxrzatg/edit?usp=sharing this project aims at ensuring the protection of the national park yanachaga chemill?n and the sustainable development of families in the buffer zone. it starts with the development of an active and participative management plan of the park, coordinated by the managing organization dris (desarrollo rural integral sustentable). an important assumption is that conservation should be part of a collective consensus en should not be an obligation. therefor activities are planned concerning the following topics: environment, biodiversity protection and sustainable management of natural resources. the strategy to attain protection and sustainable management is to strengthen the capacities of the direction and administration of the park, together with the management committee and the civil society, through the collective elaboration of projects and productive activities for socio-economic development. the project aims at consolidating an inclusive model for the management of protected areas that allows actors of the civil society and families in the buffer zone to be actively involved in the management of the national park.

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qsqkj6s2rfx3lcmmc/edit?usp=sharing this project will be implemented in certified indigenous communities in the districts of masisea and ipar?a in the province of coronel portillo in the ucayali region, peru, from january 2011 to june 2012. the project aims to help preserve tropical community forests and improve the quality of life of the indigenous communities in the ucayali region. it will do so through the sustainable production of the resources available in their community forests in the current context of globalisation and trading economy and by allowing the quality and quantity of the sustainable production of woody forest products to increase in certified community forests of three communities by reinforcing the knowledge and techniques of sustainable exploitation and production of wood products in the quantity and quality required by the certified wood market. in order to give the proposal a sustainable character, a company vision and permanent technical assistance are used.

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qst0rlzgrja1vxsnm/edit?usp=sharing the specific aim of this project is to encourage local secoya and kichwa communities to choose a sustainable development model, in view of biodiversity conservation and the sustainable management of the natural resources of the exceptional ecosystem in the alto putumayo area. to this end, investments are above all made in building capacity and knowledge around the following themes: internal organisation and strong leadership, administration, status management, drafting of internal regulations, communication, situation of categorisation process zrg, the preparation of co-management of reservas comunales, sustainable management of natural resources and monitoring of territories (in cooperation with icca), eco-system services, indigenous rights and rights regarding the extraction of natural resources, and the situation of oil blocks 117a and b, and 187. secondly, the communities are supported by app in defending their rights through legal actions and lobbying. app also supports indigenous federations in obtaining and maintaining their legal status.

la situación actual en la cuenca del vilcanota de la región cusco, presenta gran cantidad de zonas con aptitud forestal, desprovistas de vegetación.se define como problema central, la degradación de los sistemas forestales para la protección y conservación de los ecosistemas la región cusco. se considera originado por las siguientes causas:causas directas • deficiente manejo forestal.• deficiente gestión en el manejo de recursos forestales.causas indirectas • escasa disponibilidad de especies forestales e inadecuado uso de suelos. • deficiente conocimiento técnico en el manejo sostenible de los recursos forestales.• débil capacidad de organización, gestión y liderazgo para el manejo de recursos forestales. • limitadas herramientas de monitoreo para la conservación de recursos forestales.el objetivo central es la recuperación de sistemas forestales para la protección y conservación de los ecosistemas correspondientes en las provincias intervenidas de la región de cusco, y como medida de mitigación al cambio climático. --- original channelcode : 51001

the mangrove ecosystem of tumbes plays a pivotal role in providing protection against tides, winds and storm surges, and habitat for a number of fish species. the native coastal communities of tumbes rely on artisanal fishing for food and income generation. already under threat from water pollution, deforestation and overfishing (black conch), climate change is affecting the stability and health of the mangrove ecosystem through increased sea level rise and variable rainfall. for example, reduced water flows during the dry season increase the salinity of the mangrove waters, while intense precipitation during the rainy season dilutes saline waters and increases sediment loads. sustainable management of mangrove ecosystems is currently compromised by lack of basic scientific information.this project aims to improve understanding of the ecosystem so that its human population can prepare effectively for the impacts of climate variability. researchers, in cooperation with community associations, local authorities and other stakeholders, will document the impact of climate variability on the ecology and sustainability of the mangrove ecosystem, investigate the sensitivity of the black conch (andara tuberculosa) and other species to changing salinity and sediment levels, and assess the economic value of environmental services provided by the mangrove ecosystem.the project is expected to lead to the development of an adaptation plan for the mangrove ecosystem and local communities, including a concerted sustainable management plan for the extraction of the black conch. given the importance of mangrove ecosystems to coastal areas throughout the world, this research has the potential to make a contribution to adaptation efforts by coastal communities beyond peru.

bio-diversity

dna barcoding is a new tool for taxonomic research. the dna barcode is a very short standardized dna sequence in a well-known gene. it provides a secure and less complicated way of identifying the species to which an animal, plant or fungus belongs than traditional observation. the barcoding tool was developed by dr paul hebert from the university of guelph, which houses the international barcode of life (ibol) project that champions barcoding. ibol's mission is to extend the barcode reference library, provide community access to these records, and create new devices to ensure rapid bio-surveillance.barcoding has numerous potential applications in, for example, resources conservation, disease prevention, detection of invasive species, water quality control, monitoring disease vectors, identification of illegally traded plants or animals, and the elimination of weed seeds in seed collections. to date, most of the barcoding research has been basic research carried out in canada and in a limited number of other countries, primarily in the north. but, there is growing interest in barcoding on the part of diverse countries from around the world, as demonstrated at the third international barcode of life conference held in mexico, november 2009.this project will allow ibol to expand the application of barcoding to developing countries. this will involve establishing barcode libraries in argentina and south africa to act as regional nodes within ibol, establishing national nodes in three developing countries (costa rica, kenya, peru) and funding one project that uses dna barcoding to address an important concern in ecosystem management in each of the five countries. the project will also allow ibol to develop appropriate guidelines for dealing with issues of access and benefit sharing (abs) that arise from the use of barcoding, to build scientific capacity in developing countries, and to establish an international network to foster dialogue between researchers and research funding organizations to promote and sustain international collaborative barcoding science.

confronted with changing environments and growing poverty and inequalities, many small-scale farmers from the andes have been forced to adopt innovative livelihood strategies. they have done this by combining practical knowledge, local talent and external assets to manage their natural resources in creative and novel ways - ways that result in increased food and income security, and allow them to escape from poverty. this project will explore ways of stimulating and scaling up the innovations of small-scale farmers. in collaboration with stakeholders, researchers will examine instances of scaled-up innovation in farm production, natural resource management and off-farm income generation and develop policies and programs in consequence. the project will focus initially on peru and be extended to other andean countries, and potentially africa.

prevention of conflicts over the use of natural resources / prévention des conflits liés à l'utilisation des ressources naturelles
prevention of conflicts over the use of natural resources / prÉvention des conflits liÉs À l'utilisation des ressources naturelles

the goal of this project is to help the peruvian government, state agencies, civil society, and the private sector prevent, manage, and resolve conflicts relating to natural resources and economic growth. the project aims to contribute to creating and maintaining a stable economic environment for equitable and sustainable economic growth in peru by reducing the economic and social impact of these conflicts. the project consists primarily of technical assistance to state agencies, especially the presidencia del consejo de ministros (similar to canada's privy council office) and regional governments, to help them develop and implement policies, practices, and programs to prevent, manage, and resolve resource-based conflicts. project activities include: training and capacity development of over 1,000 public officials, and other stakeholders, in conflict management and prevention; creation and implementation of tools to address conflicts, and to reach mutually agreeable agreements; support for the creation and operation of regional conflict management offices; and, support for the creation and operation of multi-sector dialogue tables at national, regional and local levels for the construction of an inclusive natural resource development agenda / ce projet vise à appuyer le gouvernement péruvien, les institutions publiques, la société civile et le secteur privé à prévenir, gérer et résoudre les conflits liés à l'utilisation des ressources naturelles et la croisssance économique. le projet s'adresse à contribuer à la création et au maintien d'un environnement économique stable pour le développement économique équitable et durable du pérou en réduisant l'impact socio-économique de ces conflits. le projet fournit essentiellement de l'assistance technique, en particulier à la ''presidencia del consejo de ministros'' (l'équivalent péruvien du bureau du conseil privé du canada) et les gouvernements régionaux dans le but de les appuyer à développer et mettre en place des politiques, des pratiques et des programmes pour la prévention, la gestion et la résolution de conflits liés à l'utilisation des ressources naturelles. les activités du projet visent plus particulièrement à: la formation et le développement des capacités de plus de 1 000 fonctionnaires et d'autres acteurs clés en ce qui est de la gestion et la prévention de conflits; la création et la mise en place d'outils pour régler les conflits et parvenir à des accords mutuellement acceptables; le soutien à la création et au fonctionnement de bureaux régionaux de gestion de conflits; et, le soutien à la création et à la mise en place de rencontres (tables rondes) multi-sectorielles aux niveaux national, régional et local pour la construction d'un agenda visant au développement des ressources naturelles de façon inclusive

the canadian lutheran world relief (clwr) program focuses on enabling women and men in disadvantaged communities to secure their rights and achieve greater control over their lives and livelihoods. it facilitates their participation in sustainable development activities, thereby empowering them to enhance their quality of life through sustainable livelihoods and increased human security. the program has three strategic objectives: (1) to strengthen just and democratic civil society and local government; (2) to support poverty reduction by building healthy, vibrant communities; and (3) to enhance gender equity programming and practices. clwr works in partnership with the lutheran world federation in india, mozambique, and zambia; with polytechnical institute tomas katari - iptk, farmers development program - prodec, and arado foundation in bolivia; and with diaconia, urpichally, and comuniciones aliadas in peru. / le programme du canadian lutheran world relief (clwr) met l'accent sur l'habilitation des femmes et des hommes dans les collectivités défavorisées afin qu'ils puissent affirmer leurs droits et avoir un plus grand contrôle sur leur vie et leurs moyens de subsistance. pour ce faire, le programme facilite leur participation à des activités de développement durable, ce qui leur donne les moyens d'améliorer leur qualité de vie grâce à des moyens de subsistance viables et une sécurité humaine accrue. le programme compte trois objectifs stratégiques : 1) renforcer une société civile et une administration locale justes et démocratiques; 2) oeuvrer à la réduction de la pauvreté par la création de collectivités dynamiques et saines; 3) améliorer les programmes et les pratiques qui prônent l'égalité entre les sexes. clwr collabore avec le lutheran world federation en inde, au mozambique et en zambie; avec l'institut polytechnique tomas katari (iptk), le prodec (programme de développement des agriculteurs) et la fondation arado en bolivie; avec diaconia, urpichally et comuniciones aliadas au pérou.

forestry policy and administrative management

this project is part of cida's international youth internship program (iyip), funded by the government of canada's youth employment strategy (yes). the iyip contributes to the yes by providing a large spectrum of canadian graduates with valuable international development work experience abroad. ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (psij) de l'acdi, programme financé par la stratégie emploi jeunesse (sej) du gouvernement du canada. le psij contribue au sej en fournissant à un large éventail de jeunes diplômé(e)s canadien(ne)s une enrichissante expérience de travail à l'étranger en développement international.

the program concentrates its activities in three sectors: private sector development through partners' institutional and organizational strengthening; good governance through local development; and promotion of environmental sustainability through agriculture, forestry, fish and cattle farming systems. every year, 22 volunteers support these efforts. the objectives of the program are: (1) help partners gain knowledge and adopt development practices that are democratic, just and sustainable; (2) help partners improve individual and collective well-being through socio-economic activities; (3) promote gender equity and empower women in gaining autonomy and influence; (4) support partners in their actions and practices leading towards viable and sustainable environmental development; and (5) promote openness for exchange and dialogue between development partners (government authorities and civil society organizations). an amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the volunteer cooperation agency programs for cida-led program evaluations. / le programme concentre ses actions dans trois secteurs, soit le soutien au développement du secteur privé par le renforcement institutionnel et organisationnel de partenaires, la promotion de la bonne gouvernance par le développement local et la promotion de la durabilité de l'environnement par des systèmes agro-sylvo-pastoraux et piscicoles. il y a 22 volontaires par année qui appuient ces efforts. les objectifs du programme visent à 1) appuyer les partenaires à acquérir et adopter des pratiques de développement démocratique, équitable et durable; 2) soutenir les partenaires dans des actions socio-économiques permettant d'améliorer le mieux-être individuel et collectif des populations visées; 3) contribuer à la promotion de l'égalité entre les femmes et les hommes et soutenir les femmes dans l'atteinte d'une plus grande autonomie d'action et d'une plus grande influence; 4) soutenir les partenaires dans leurs actions et pratiques menant à un développement environnemental viable et durable; 5) favoriser la création d'espaces d'échanges et de dialogues entre partenaires du développement (instances gouvernementales et organisations de la société civile). un montant de $ 80 622 a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire, pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l’acdi.

this volunteer sending program is designed to send 636 volunteers to 13 developing countries. it aims to: (1) enable partners to provide women and men with the capacity to exercise their economic rights and to reduce their vulnerability to change; (2) enable civil society to establish effective dialogues with the government to identify policies and strategies that benefit vulnerable populations regarding the issues linked to essential health, education and drinking water services; (3) enable partners to strengthen women’s leadership and increase their capacity to influence, to identify strategies that eliminate all forms of violence and discrimination towards them, to ensure the defence and the promotion of their rights, and to involve men in this regard; and (4) enable partners to better defend youth issues in local policies, to promote access to essential education and health services for youth, and make youth stakeholders in society. as of the final year of the program, in april 2014, programming will extend to colombia and mali in the form of a regional approach. an amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the volunteer cooperation agency programs for cida-led program evaluations. / ce programme d'envoi de volontaires permet l'envoi de 636 volontaires dans 13 pays en voie de développement. il vise à : 1) habiliter les partenaires afin de donner aux femmes et aux hommes les capacités d'exercer leurs droits économiques et à réduire leur vulnérabilité face aux changements; 2) habiliter la société civile afin qu'elle soit en mesure d'établir un dialogue efficace avec le gouvernement afin d'identifier des politiques et stratégies en faveur des populations vulnérables sur les questions touchant les services essentiels en matière de santé, d'éducation et d'eau potable; 3) habiliter les partenaires afin de renforcer le leadership des femmes et d'accroître leur capacité d'influence, d'identifier des stratégies pour éliminer toute forme de violence et de discrimination à leur égard, d'assurer la défense et la promotion de leurs droits et d'impliquer les hommes dans cette démarche; 4) habiliter les partenaires afin qu'ils soient en mesure de mieux défendre la position des jeunes face aux politiques locales, de favoriser l'accès des jeunes à des services essentiels d'éducation et de santé et d'en faire des acteurs de la société. lors de la dernière année du programme, à compter d’avril 2014, la colombie et le mali feront leur entrée dans la programmation dans une approche régionale. un montant de 80 622 $ a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l’acdi.

this project is part of cida's international youth internship program (iyip), funded by the government of canada's youth employment strategy (yes). the iyip contributes to the yes by providing a large spectrum of canadian graduates with valuable international development work experience abroad. / ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (psij) de l'acdi, programme financé par la stratégie emploi jeunesse (sej) du gouvernement du canada. le psij contribue au sej en fournissant à un large éventail de jeunes diplômé(e)s canadien(ne)s une enrichissante expérience de travail à l'étranger en développement international.
strengthening natural resource management / renforcer la gestion des ressources naturelles
strengthening natural resource management / renforcer la gestion des ressources naturelles

this project aims to strengthen natural resource management and improve the way in which environmental policy is implemented in five regional governments in peru (piura, la libertad, loreto, arequipa, and cusco) and in key agencies within the central government. the project seeks to do this by training and coaching, research and policy development, and by creating linkages and knowledge sharing opportunities (such as internships, conferences, and working groups) among key stakeholders and experts in the private, public, civil society, and academic sectors. / ce projet vise à renforcer la gestion des ressources naturelles et améliorer la mise en œuvre de politiques environnementales au sein de cinq gouvernements régionaux au pérou (piura, la libertad, loreto, arequipa et cusco) ainsi qu'au sein d'agences clés du gouvernement central. le projet vise à accomplir cela par l'entremise d'activités de formation et de coaching, des recherches et l'élaboration de politiques, ainsi que la création de liens et de possibilités de partage de connaissances (tels que des stages, des conférences et des groupes de travail) parmi les principaux acteurs et experts du secteur privé, du secteur public, de la société civil et du secteur académique.

as part of the 2009-2015 volunteer cooperation program, cuso international places 1400 sector-focused skilled volunteers to build the capacity of partner organizations in 26 countries. volunteer placements are both long- and short-term in nature, and include multiple types of volunteering options: north-south, south-south, south-north, national, diaspora and business partnerships. volunteers focus on capacity building (through sharing of knowledge, methodologies, and/or tools relating to specific capacity areas) and enhancing the ability of partners to influence development policy. partners include local civil society organizations, national and local governments and various networks and associations. cuso international also delivers a public engagement program in canada designed to deepen understanding amongst canadians and create opportunities for informed action on international development issues. cuso international works in the following sectors: education, with a particular focus on the inclusion of women and girls in educational options; hiv and aids, with a particular focus on the vulnerability of woman and girls, and the rights of people to have access to services; participation and governance / access to justice, by aiming to empower poor and marginalized groups, especially women, to fulfill rights of access to basic services, and by ensuring access to justice for women and children; youth social and economic inclusion, by creating opportunities for training and employment for young women and men facing poverty, underemployment and social exclusion; protecting environments; managing natural resources, by strengthening community-level governance mechanisms, including the participation of women in community decision-making, aimed at better local management of natural resources; gender equality, by incorporating ge as a crosscutting theme throughout all programming components, and through local ge capacity building activities with partners. an amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the volunteer cooperation agency programs for cida-led program evaluations. / dans le cadre du programme de coopération volontaire 2009-2015, cuso international place 1 400 volontaires compétents dans des secteurs ciblés afin de développer la capacité des organisations partenaires dans 26 pays. les postes volontaires sont à la fois à court terme et à long terme et offrent de multiples options de volontariat : partenariats nord-sud, sud-sud, sud-nord, nationaux, de diaspora et d’affaires. les volontaires se concentrent sur le développement des capacités par l’entremise du partage des connaissances, des méthodologies, ou des outils liés à des domaines particuliers en matière de capacité. ils se concentrent également sur le rehaussement de la capacité des partenaires à influencer les politiques de développement. les partenaires comprennent des organisations locales de la société civile, des gouvernements locaux et divers réseaux et ass

as part of the 2009-2015 volunteer cooperation program, cuso international places 1400 sector-focused skilled volunteers to build the capacity of partner organizations in 26 countries. volunteer placements are both long- and short-term in nature, and include multiple types of volunteering options: north-south, south-south, south-north, national, diaspora and business partnerships. volunteers focus on capacity building (through sharing of knowledge, methodologies, and/or tools relating to specific capacity areas) and enhancing the ability of partners to influence development policy. partners include local civil society organizations, national and local governments and various networks and associations. cuso international also delivers a public engagement program in canada designed to deepen understanding amongst canadians and create opportunities for informed action on international development issues. cuso international works in the following sectors: education, with a particular focus on the inclusion of women and girls in educational options; hiv and aids, with a particular focus on the vulnerability of woman and girls, and the rights of people to have access to services; participation and governance / access to justice, by aiming to empower poor and marginalized groups, especially women, to fulfill rights of access to basic services, and by ensuring access to justice for women and children; youth social and economic inclusion, by creating opportunities for training and employment for young women and men facing poverty, underemployment and social exclusion; protecting environments; managing natural resources, by strengthening community-level governance mechanisms, including the participation of women in community decision-making, aimed at better local management of natural resources; gender equality, by incorporating ge as a crosscutting theme throughout all programming components, and through local ge capacity building activities with partners. an amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the volunteer cooperation agency programs for cida-led program evaluations. / dans le cadre du programme de coopération volontaire 2009-2015, cuso international place 1 400 volontaires compétents dans des secteurs ciblés afin de développer la capacité des organisations partenaires dans 26 pays. les postes volontaires sont à la fois à court terme et à long terme et offrent de multiples options de volontariat : partenariats nord-sud, sud-sud, sud-nord, nationaux, de diaspora et d’affaires. les volontaires se concentrent sur le développement des capacités par l’entremise du partage des connaissances, des méthodologies, ou des outils liés à des domaines particuliers en matière de capacité. ils se concentrent également sur le rehaussement de la capacité des partenaires à influencer les politiques de développement. les partenaires comprennent des organisations locales de la société civile, des gouvernements locaux et divers réseaux et ass

the canadian lutheran world relief (clwr) program focuses on enabling women and men in disadvantaged communities to secure their rights and achieve greater control over their lives and livelihoods. it facilitates their participation in sustainable development activities, thereby empowering them to enhance their quality of life through sustainable livelihoods and increased human security. the program has three strategic objectives: (1) to strengthen just and democratic civil society and local government; (2) to support poverty reduction by building healthy, vibrant communities; and (3) to enhance gender equity programming and practices. clwr works in partnership with the lutheran world federation in india, mozambique, and zambia; with polytechnical institute tomas katari - iptk, farmers development program - prodec, and arado foundation in bolivia; and with diaconia, urpichally, and comuniciones aliadas in peru. / le programme du canadian lutheran world relief (clwr) met l'accent sur l'habilitation des femmes et des hommes dans les collectivités défavorisées afin qu'ils puissent affirmer leurs droits et avoir un plus grand contrôle sur leur vie et leurs moyens de subsistance. pour ce faire, le programme facilite leur participation à des activités de développement durable, ce qui leur donne les moyens d'améliorer leur qualité de vie grâce à des moyens de subsistance viables et une sécurité humaine accrue. le programme compte trois objectifs stratégiques : 1) renforcer une société civile et une administration locale justes et démocratiques; 2) oeuvrer à la réduction de la pauvreté par la création de collectivités dynamiques et saines; 3) améliorer les programmes et les pratiques qui prônent l'égalité entre les sexes. clwr collabore avec le lutheran world federation en inde, au mozambique et en zambie; avec l'institut polytechnique tomas katari (iptk), le prodec (programme de développement des agriculteurs) et la fondation arado en bolivie; avec diaconia, urpichally et comuniciones aliadas au pérou.

this volunteer sending program supports the assignment of 3,931 canadian and developing-country volunteers with partner organizations in developing countries. the program aims to support partner organizations working on health and environment-related initiatives through projects in the following sectors: (1) primary health care; (2) family planning and reproductive health care; (3) food and nutrition; (4) environmental conservation, pollution prevention, and capacity building in environmental management; and (5) equality between women and men. the program also includes a public engagement component that furthers the promotion of development awareness in canada. an amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the volunteer cooperation agency programs for cida-led program evaluations. / ce programme d’envoi de volontaires soutient la mission de 3 931 bénévoles canadiens et ceux provenant des pays en développement, en collaboration avec les organisations partenaires dans les pays en développement. le programme vise à soutenir les organisations partenaires qui travaillent dans des initiatives liées à la santé et à l’environnement dans les secteurs suivants : 1) les soins de santé de base; 2) la planification familiale et des soins liés à la fonction reproductive; 3) l’alimentation et à la nutrition; 4) la conservation de l’environnement, la prévention de la pollution et le développement des capacités en matière de gestion de l’environnement; 5) l’égalité entre les femmes et les hommes. le programme comprend également un élément d’engagement du public pour davantage favoriser la sensibilisation au développement au canada. un montant de $ 80 622 a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire, pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l’acdi.

atlantic council for international cooperation - international internships 2013-2014 / conseil atlantique pour la coopération internationale - stages internationaux 2013-2014
atlantic council for international cooperation - international internships 2013-2014 / conseil atlantique pour la coopÉration internationale - stages

this project is part of cida's international youth internship program (iyip), funded by the government of canada's youth employment strategy (yes). the iyip contributes to the yes by providing a large spectrum of canadian graduates with valuable international development work experience abroad. ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (psij) de l'acdi, programme financé par la stratégie emploi jeunesse (sej) du gouvernement du canada. le psij contribue au sej en fournissant à un large éventail de jeunes diplômé(e)s canadien(ne)s une enrichissante expérience de travail à l'étranger en développement international.

this project is part of cida's international youth internship program (iyip), funded by the government of canada's youth employment strategy (yes). the iyip contributes to the yes by providing a large spectrum of canadian graduates with valuable international development work experience abroad. ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (psij) de l'acdi, programme financé par la stratégie emploi jeunesse (sej) du gouvernement du canada. le psij contribue au sej en fournissant à un large éventail de jeunes diplômé(e)s canadien(ne)s une enrichissante expérience de travail à l'étranger en développement international.

background the iuc partnership with unalm started on 1 april 2010, after having successfully terminated the pre-partnerprogramme started on 1 october 2008.the partner programme is made of seven multidisciplinary projects gathered around the central theme of sustainable management of agro-ecosystems and rural development :cluster 1: research on sustainable management of agro-ecosystemsproject 1: farming systems research (5 subprojects)project 2: development of value chains for biodiversity conservation and improvement of rural livelihoods (3 subprojects + 1 transversal)project 3: agrarian innovation and management of participatory knowledge systems (1 subproject linked to subprojects in p1 and p2)cluster 2: educationproject 4: educational innovation in undergraduate and graduate programs with emphasis on the sustainable management of agro-ecosystems and rural developmentcluster 3: institutional capacity building and infrastructure development project 5: capacity building and infrastructure development of tics, library and language centerproject 6: capacity building and infrastructure development of regional development centers (irds)project 7: institutional change and logistic project supportthe core values of the dominant philosophy of the unalm s strategic plan have been guiding the identification and formulation of this program. these values are: sustainable system, natural resources, food, human interaction and social justice, excellence and flexibility and responsiveness. the unalm is the official state agricultural university of peru; as such it is the only specialized academic institution in peru that provides higher-level education in disciplines related to agrarian, forest, environmental engineering, natural resource economics, food sciences and rural development at the national level. general objectives developmental overall objective :improving the food security, the local income, the stability and competitiveness of the agro-ecosystems and thus the overall livelihood situation of the local population through identification and remediation of key agronomic, socio-economic and environmental constraints of small scale family based agriculture in peru.academic overall objective :develop, increase, consolidate and internationalize unalm s academic capacity in research, education, knowledge-transfer and technological innovation in sustainable management of agro-ecosystems to generate leadership in the peruvian rural sector by maximizing the institutional impact. specific objectives unalm is strengthened in research, education and service to society thanks to the results of 7 multidisciplinary research and institutional projectsp1 : farming systemsp2 : devlopment of value chains for biodiversity conservation and improvement of rural livelihoodsp3 : agrarian innovation and management of participatory knowledge systems in the peruvian coast and andesp4 : educational innovation in undergraduate and graduate progrmas with empha

general objectives een leefbaar bestaan en structurele versterking van organisaties van familiale boeren en boerinnen in het zuiden en het noorden, door een eerlijke toegang tot markten en door ontwikkeling van duurzame land-bouwketens. specific objectives tegen 2013 zijn er duurzame landbouwketens, bij voorkeur op lokaal én regionaal niveau, waarin georganiseerde familiale boeren (zo-wel mannen als vrouwen) met succes de handelsrelaties beïnvloeden (prijs, grondstoffen, machtsverhoudingen, ...) en hun inkomen verbeteren results r1de productie is beter afgestemd op de markt wat betreft volume, kwaliteit, diversiteit en/of continuïteit en gebeurd meer op een ecologisch verantwoorde wijze.r2het volume, de kwaliteit en/of de diversiteit van verwerkte producten is toegenomen op een meer efficiënte wijze en met aandacht voor het milieu en de rol van vrouwen in verwerking .r3een groter volume van producten werd gecommercialiseerd door het aangaan van langdurige contracten met groothandelaars en het aanboren van nieuwe markten die een betere prijs garanderen .r4meer producten werden verkocht via detailhandelaars en via directe verkoop tussen producent en consument met een certificeringsysteem .r5er is een betere inter-professionele coördinatie tussen de diverse ketenactoren en financiële en niet-financiële service providers met een sterkere stem van boerenorganisaties.

background en las zonas de intervención, el programa permitirá el uso adecuado y sostenible de los recursos naturales (renovables y no renovables), lo que contribuirá a la reducción de la pobreza y a la preservación del patrimonio natural (conservación de la biodiversidad, recursos hídricos sostenibles y alto a la deforestación). además, la mejora de la producción agrícola orientada al mercado local, junto con la participación positiva de las mujeres, promoverán la seguridad alimentaria y contribuirán a reducir la malnutrición. general objectives nivel de pobreza de los hombres y mujeres de las regiones considerados en el ámbito del programa reducido aprovechando en forma ordenada los recursos naturales y tomando en cuenta las necesidades de las generaciones futuras. specific objectives al 2015, los recursos naturales en el ámbito de influencia del programa son identificados, valorizados, conservados y utilizados de manera sostenible de acuerdo a una planificación a largo plazo y con una mayor productividad, competitividad y acceso a mercados para los hombres y mujeres que inicialmente vivían en pobreza y extrema pobreza.

preservation of the biodiversity and sustainable management of the natural resources in the alto putumayo area
preservation of the biodiversity and sustainable management of the natural resources in the alto putumayo area

the specific aim of this project is to encourage local secoya and kichwa communities to choose a sustainable development model, in view of biodiversity conservation and the sustainable management of the natural resources of the exceptional ecosystem in the alto putumayo area. to this end, investments are above all made in building capacity and knowledge around the following themes: internal organisation and strong leadership, administration, status management, drafting of internal regulations, communication, situation of categorisation process zrg, the preparation of co-management of reservas comunales, sustainable management of natural resources and monitoring of territories (in cooperation with icca), eco-system services, indigenous rights and rights regarding the extraction of natural resources, and the situation of oil blocks 117a and b, and 187. secondly, the communities are supported by app in defending their rights through legal actions and lobbying. app also supports indigenous federations in obtaining and maintaining their legal status. expected outcome: 1: internal organisation and leadership at the level of the communities and both federations are being strengthened.2: there is greater legal security for the communities, their territories and their federations.3: the indigenous peoples know their indigenous rights and their rights regarding the exploitation of natural resources and defend these rights by legal actions and lobbying.4: the indigenous population has been informed of the current state of the categorisation of the zona reservada guëppí (zrg) and are aware of the central topics of conservation and ecosystem services and joint management of protected natural areas. document available at https://docs.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qst0rlzgrja1vxsnm/edit?usp=sharing

this project aims at ensuring the protection of the national park yanachaga chemillén and the sustainable development of families in the buffer zone. it starts with the development of an active and participative management plan of the park, coordinated by the managing organization dris (desarrollo rural integral sustentable). an important assumption is that conservation should be part of a collective consensus en should not be an obligation. therefor activities are planned concerning the following topics: environment, biodiversity protection and sustainable management of natural resources. the strategy to attain protection and sustainable management is to strengthen the capacities of the direction and administration of the park, together with the management committee and the civil society, through the collective elaboration of projects and productive activities for socio-economic development. the project aims at consolidating an inclusive model for the management of protected areas that allows actors of the civil society and families in the buffer zone to be actively involved in the management of the national park. expected outcome: 1. the directors and the executive committee of pnych are increasing their management skills in the field of resource management, public use and financial sustainability2. it has an updated master plan with the technical strategy for managing the yanachaga chemillén national park for the next 5 years.3. the families of settlers and natives who have settled in the buffer zone of pnych use productive alternatives for the sustainable management of natural resources. document available at https://docs.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qscep6tfixsxrzatg/edit?usp=sharing

this project will be implemented in certified indigenous communities in the districts of masisea and iparía in the province of coronel portillo in the ucayali region, peru, from january 2011 to june 2012. the project aims to help preserve tropical community forests and improve the quality of life of the indigenous communities in the ucayali region. it will do so through the sustainable production of the resources available in their community forests in the current context of globalisation and trading economy and by allowing the quality and quantity of the sustainable production of woody forest products to increase in certified community forests of three communities by reinforcing the knowledge and techniques of sustainable exploitation and production of wood products in the quantity and quality required by the certified wood market. in order to give the proposal a sustainable character, a company vision and permanent technical assistance are used. expected outcome: 1: increased knowledge of techniques in sustainable wood production in certified community forests among members of the productive units (oeps) of the 3 indigenous communities concerned.2: indigenous communities produce wood in quantities and of a quality in line with market demands for certified wood.3: the oeps of the indigenous communities manage the wood production of their certified community forests and delivery to the cooperative storage site with a corporate vision. document available at https://docs.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qsqkj6s2rfx3lcmmc/edit?usp=sharing

this project wants to contribute to the conservation of the community reserve amarakaeri and the sustainable development of the indigenous and mestizo communities in the buffer zone thereby strengthening the capacities of the administration (both the local government and communities) of the community reserve amarakaeri . the main goal is the participation of both the government (sernanp), local managers, local development actors and the population of the buffer zone. expected outcome: 1. the head administration of the community reserve amarakaeri has improved her capacities in themes of participatory organization, management of resources and financial sustainability;2. the management comité of the community reserve has improved her capacities in the management and the themes of conservation and sustainable use of resources; about which she successfully communicates with regional and local governments; 3. technical, legal and organisatory support in the sustainable management in three communities of the community reserve amarakaeri document available at https://drive.google.com/file/d/0b-iuzkyan-qstvfsuflqbgjfmhc/edit

la propuesta busca como objetivo de largo plazo, evitar el recrudecimiento de la pobreza en el ámbito priorizado, mediante su contribución al mantenimiento o mejora de la capacidad productiva de los recursos naturales que son la base del sustento de la población y que resulta del impacto de las políticas y medidas implementadas para una mejor adaptación al cambio climático en la región.

the ssnc support civil society organisations in the environment movement in south with regard to five sub-programs: agriculture and food security, climate, marine ecosystems, chemicals and forests. the support comprises 67 cooperation partners in africa, latin america, four regional networks and eight global networks.

face au recul des glaciers dans la cordillère péruvienne, la population et les autorités disposent des compétences nécessaires en matière d’adaptation afin de garantir l’approvisionnement en eau potable et d’irrigation tout en étant à même de gérer les risques de manière à les minimiser. - (a) local - plan de gestion hydrique dans deux bassins versants (huaraz et cusco), monitorage intégral et système d’alerte; (b) académique - développement d’une offre de formation post grade articulée entre trois universités, développement des capacités au sein de ces universités; (c) institutionnel - développement de capacités et plaidoyer politique.

the rural high andean population in peru suffers the impacts of climate change as their farming-based livelihoods are highly climate-dependent. the next phase of pacc will promote and catalyze the scaling up of adaptation measures that proved effective during the previous phases of the program. evidence based public policies that enable and promote adaptive responses in agriculture and natural resources management will further serve as valuable input for the global dialogue.

basado en las iniciativas impulsados por el centro del patrimonio mundial en otras regiones, la meta del proyecto será mantener la biodiversidad y diversidad cultural del parque nacional del manu, sitio de patrimonio mundial en relación a los impactos emergentes del cambio climático, riesgo de desastre, y desarrollo humano. para ello se buscará el incremento de la resiliencia de “el manu”, ante las amenazas por cambio climático, por medio de una activa y responsable participación local, asegurando la conservación del valor universal excepcional del parque nacional del manu

for one of the first time in its history, sdc can exert important leverage effects – with little funding – upon nation-wide and international scaling up operations in peru. the global program water initiatives decided to support this new generation of projects to demonstrate how sdc can generate added value and influence the global debate. the peruvian authorities want to capitalize on sdc 15-year experience in rural water and sanitation in rural areas for boosting full national coverage of such services.this initiative is a new generation of projets required to respond: to the water & sanitation mdg’s water related targets and to the human right to access to water & sanitation.

le programme d adaptation au changement climatique a comme finalité de contribuer à consolider les conditions de vie des communautés dans les régions andines de cusco et apurimac en réduisant la vulnérabilité - surtout des couches sociales défavorisées - face aux conséquences du changement climatique. les résultats attendus du pacc à l horizon 2011-2012 sont au nombre de quatre: 1. connaître la vulnérabilité - les régions de cusco et apurimac ont développé des diagnostics et dressé la liste des conditions d adaptation au changement climatique avec la participation des populations affectées, de leurs autorités et d institutions spécialisées. 2. mesurer et informer - un système régional d information publique sur le changement climatique et ses effets est établi et validé par les autorités. 3. agir dans des districts choisis - des mesures d adaptation priorisées sont mises en œuvre dans des districts sélectionnés dans chacune des deux régions. 4. apprendre et influencer les politiques publiques - le thème de l adaptation au changement climatique est bien présent dans les politiques publiques, aux trois niveaux : pays, régions et municipalités rurales, en s inspirent des expériences générées par le pacc.

sólo en perú, la población joven (18 a 30) representa el 29,5% del electorado, y tendrá que adaptarse a las futuras condiciones relacionadas al cambio climático. ello implica que las decisiones tomadas hoy tendrán un impacto en la calidad y estilo de vida que lleven. en ese sentido, contar con organizaciones y redes bien informadas y sensibilizadas en el tema de cambio climático, resultará estratégico para avanzar en la acción desde la misma población, tanto para incrementar su resiliencia como asumir su responsabilidad ante el fenómeno. por ello, se ha visto la necesidad de contar con un programa de comunicación e incidencia que se enfoque en jóvenes, para impulsar que ellos asuman un rol protagónico y activo en la incidencia en la opinión pública, con la finalidad de posicionar en la agenda política el tema del cambio climático como un tema de desarrollo y como una prioridad

the state secretariat for economic seco has supported the development of an biotrade-programme of the united nations conference on trade and development (unctad) since 2002, to preserve wild biodiversity through its commercial utilization. perubiodiverso, the second phase of the peruvian biotrade project has three major components: 1. improvement of the competitiveness thanks to better product quality and development of new innovative biotrade products. 2. enhanced market access through targeted supply and demand analyses and training of different actors (producers, processors, etc.) along the supply chain. 3. improved framework conditions through policy dialogue, awareness rainig and consulting services regarding international regulation. the project is implemented by the deutsche gesellschaft für internationale zusammenarbeit (giz) in collaboration with the swiss import promotion programme sippo.
bio-diversity

discovered at the site of el brujo in ascope province, home of the moche people from ad 100 to 700, the mummies, as organic remains, require special preservation and storage. this project involves the cleaning and cataloguing of the mummy bundles and upgrades to the storage facilities at the museum.

urku estudios amazónicos (urku), $272,000 over three years urku will work to engage communities in the san martín region in the conservation of their forests through an integrated program of resource management and recovery of biodiversity . in collaboration with the federación kichwa huallaga dorado (fekihd), it will develop ecotourism; producer networks to market coffee, medicinal plants and crafts; a system to monitor the environment; and environmental education. the project is expected to benefit 5,600 peruvians directly, help protect the local ecosystem and generate revenue toward supporting the conservation efforts of the participating communities.

taller de capacitación e investigación familiar (tacif), $138,360 over three years; counterpart committed, $128,585 tacif will help 130 indigenous peruvians improve their nutrition and income by expanding their production and marketing of native fish, farmed in ponds, and diversifying these enterprises. the activities planned, which are also expected to reduce overfishing in the amazon river basin, will take place in santa maria de ojeal, a rural community in the punchana district of the department of loreto.

the general objective of the sierra-natural resources management and poverty alleviation project is to help alleviate the poverty of rural sierra people. specific project objectives are to assist the poor to: (1) improve sustainable management of natural resources through soil conservation measures and reforestation at the micro-catchment level; (2) increase rural production and productivity through introduction of irrigation and improved agricultural practices; and (3) strengthen their rural organizations so that they can become autonomous and sustainable entities. the project has four components: (1) participative identification and formulation of rural investments in micro-catchments; (2) rural investments; (3) strengthening of rural community institutions; and (4) logistical support and training to the implementing agency (pronamachcs).

the second rural roads project in peru, will increase access to basic social services, and to economic, and income-generating activities, to help alleviate rural poverty. the components will: 1) finance roads rehabilitation, to improve accessibility to rural areas, and restore operating conditions along regional economic corridors. unpaved primary, and secondary roads will be selected for rehabilitation, to be integrated into the consolidated road network; 2) routine, and periodic maintenance of rural roads, and connecting primary, and secondary roads will be strengthened, based on a co-financing arrangement between the central government, and benefited local governments; 3) improve the non-motorized rural transport, by providing technical assistance for village-level infrastructure management, to include community participation in the planning, and implementation of works; 4) pilot an institutional model for managing the rural road network at the provincial level, whose municipal authorities will jointly assume responsibility over the development of a core provincial road network. this will avoid current institutional, and financial segmentation, that prevents municipalities from undertaking integrated initiatives, or responsibilities; 5) pilot the development of strategic frameworks for improving rural accessibility in the selva region. the pilot will ascertain technical, institutional, environmental, and economic guidelines to set an inter-modal transportation system along rivers; and, 6) further develop the institutional building program, already underway, to improve rural transport policy, and strategies; to improve planning, and management of rural roads; and, to develop community-based micro-enterprises for road maintenance.

the main objective of the lima transport project for peru is to assist the municipality of metropolitan lima (mml) in enhancing the economic productivity and the quality of life within the lima metropolitan area through improving mobility and accessibility for the metropolitan population, especially in the peri-urban poor neighborhoods by establishing an efficient, reliable, cleaner and safer mass rapid transit system. the specific project development objectives are to: (i) implement the new mass rapid transit system on the basis of a public private partnership (ppp) with concessional bus corridor/feeder routes operations and fare collection system; (ii) improve access within low income areas through facilitating the use of low cost transport alternatives, such as bicycles and walking; (iii) strengthen the local institutional capacity to regulate and manage the metropolitan transport system on a sustainable basis; and (iv) reduce the negative environmental impact of motorized transport in lima. the extension is necessary to: (i) implement the social mitigation plan. the project affects some owners of old buses and other parties related to this business. the project introduces modern buses that will replace several hundred old buses. a social plan has been finalized and its implementation will take place as the old buses are displaced by the new system. as said, the project will enter operations gradually. this process will take place beyond the current closing date; (ii) implement the communications plan, which was recently approved by the bank, as well as the air quality monitoring network; and (iii) reengage protransporte and the barranco representatives in light of the (spanish fund for latin america and the caribbean) sflac-financed traffic management study, part of management's action plan for the on-going inspection panel. the study will have intermediate results by august 2010 and final results by september 2010.
